page.title: 15The Miners Strike (cont)
page.content: {deputies}went back but came back out again and the same happened at Dinnington pit. Wales was still extremely solid, only 1% of its workforce went back to work. There was one very sad occasion, in Wales as a taxi driver who was taking a working miner to work was killed as a concrete slab was dropped onto his car, it was aimed at the working miner. The Notts miners were still at work, one man labelled as the{"Silver Birch"}went to court to try and get an High Court injunction against the N.U.M. The so called "Silver Birch" was the leader of the "Notts Working Miners". Meeting after meeting failed and the N.C.B. spokesman{Michael Eaton}was silenced by the N.C.B. Then one day in March 1985 an emergency meeting between NUM officials and the NCB representatives took place. These talks were expected
